file_content.text: Coming back... really reminds me how much I hate this planet.
Our scouts tracked the pirates' trail back to the starship graveyard. Right to a dreadnaught. The thing's a fortress.
That must be where Valon's hiding out.
The pirate base, perhaps.
And he won't just be sitting there.
I didn't know there were so many crashed ships here.
A whole starship graveyard?
Some space battle years ago--Republic and Imperial ships both.
Then let's go and get him.
Wait, wait a second.
These scavengers use special gear to get salvage out of the ice. Valon's men went straight for it.
I think Valon's planning to raise the old Republic dreadnaught from the graveyard. Then he'd have his own flagship.
With his healing armor, and a ship that size, every pirate on Hoth would join him.
And command the White Maw.
We've just captured the equipment Valon needs to raise the ship.
But he can't do that now.
This isn't the only salvaging gear on Hoth, Jedi. We should hurry.
More bad news.
Yeah. We have to get in there.
This will be rough. That class of ship used heavy security doors as choke points. Plus the scouts reported lots of pirates....
Wait, LT. Jedi, you've put yourself on the line for us over and over.
That's right. Now it's our turn.
Valon wants that ship to fly, right? So what if we hit the engines? He'll send his men to protect them.
What if we attack the flagship's engines? Valon wants the ship, he'll have to defend them....
That'll work. We'll keep Valon's men out of the way, Jedi. You finish him for us.
Thank you. Watch your backs and help each other; I want you all back alive.
Be careful out there.
No Jedi could make a nobler gesture.
I'm proud of you.
History remembers the bold. Hold nothing back.
Win, or die as heroes.
I'm with them, Jedi. Right now, I... I wouldn't want to be shoulder to shoulder with anyone else.
Our radios won't work out here, but I'll send you an alert when we've disabled the engines. We'll join you if we can.
Find some way past those security doors and get to Valon. I just hope I'll be there for the finish.
I've got an update. This is big.
Our--wait, is that Private Kree? Was he in on this?
Kree snapped under the strain. This isn't your fault.
Don't blame yourself.
It was my job to take the pressure off him. But--we've got another problem.
He thought he could save himself by guiding Valon's men here.
I'm afraid so.
Let's hope he didn't give them any intelligence. We've got enough trouble.
First he tries to kill you, then betrays us. Good job, Lieutenant.
You're not much of a leader.
Not one of those "inspirational" Jedi, are you? I'll... deal with this later.
So... Valon's secret is this special armor? Huh.
You know, we did get intel about an Imperial lab hidden nearby. If the Empire was studying that armor, we might find information there.
If you knew this lab was there, surely you could have destroyed it.
Why didn't you attack the lab?
We didn't have the numbers; the place is crawling with guards.
Any laboratory good enough to work on the armor will be surrounded.
It won't be unguarded.
Yeah, we scouted it. There's guards in snow hides around the whole perimeter.
That's a stretch of logic.
Lab's well-equipped and very well-guarded. If I was an Imperial with a big secret, I'd study it there.
A frontal assault would really cost us, but we could handle the guards while you get inside.
Or... we could try luring them out, get them lost in the snow. Risky, but less risky than fighting. It's your call.
Draw them out into the snow. Don't fight unless you have to.
Lure the guards away.
Minimal casualties and we get to be sneaky. Outstanding.
You know the terrain and your men better than I do.
What would you do?
Safer to draw them out, then. We don't have the numbers for a straight fight.
That lab could house other secrets. Make sure those guards are eliminated.
I want you to kill them.
Good point. We won't let you down.
All right. We take the guards; you get in and see what you can find. I'll find you when we're clear.
Everyone, get your gear! We're hitting both Valon and the Empire on this one!
They tracked us back here, LT! Those scouts were coordinated!
Captain Valon's still alive, isn't he? You lied to us! Were you in on this, Jedi?
Yes, but I've discovered how Valon keeps surviving.
I know Valon's secret.
It's too late for that!
I apologize. It was necessary, for the mission.
I'm sorry for deceiving you.
Lieutenant! How could you deceive your men like that?
[Lie] Of course not!
We always wondered how you escaped the Imps, LT. Now this! We--we're not gonna stay here and die!
Talk or shoot, Private. Don't try and do both, okay?
You're in command, Jedi. I keep very special punishment chores for soldiers who step out of line.
Maybe that will teach him to respect the chain of command.
Good. Give him one.
The private's scared, and he made a mistake. Let him make amends.
He deserves another chance.
That's forgiveness, Kree. Remember it, because if you push your luck again, the memory is all you'll have.
He tried to kill you! He should be sentenced for mutiny!
No court martial?
By who, a board of tauntauns? Plus Hoth is worse than any prison.
Congratulations, Kree! You get to chip ice off the comm tower's aerials for a week.
Y--yes. Yes, sir.
But Kree's right! We can't stop Valon, no one can!
Everyone, listen! Valon's only advantage is that he knows something you don't--an advantage he's now lost.
I know his secret.
He wears healing armor he took from an Imperial lab. Without it, he's just another man!
Valon isn't some monster. He's just been lucky.
Of course you can.
He stole some armor from an Imperial lab. It heals his injuries and makes him seem invincible!
You're jumping at shadows! Somewhere out there, Valon is laughing at you!
You've all been duped!
He stole special armor that keeps him alive from an Imperial lab. Are you afraid of a scientist's toy?
Jedi, give us a hand here!
Thought I'd find you skulking there, Jedi. You're gonna pay for that insult. You and the Republic!
I defeated you. I saw your corpse.
Valon? Impossible.
A fake hologram can't fool me, I know Captain Valon is dead.
This must be a trick.
Jedi, I don't think this is a fake.
Think you're pretty smart, don't you? Try your brain on this.
It seems I didn't hit you hard enough.
Not dead yet?
Now you never will.
We just found the heat exchanger for all the Republic bases. Might have ransomed it back, too.
But since you crossed me, it's history--and you all freeze.
That son of a... my men will be back from exercise soon. They can't know Valon's alive!
Your men might help us unravel this mystery.
But I need their input.
No! If they catch on that Valon survived a duel with a Jedi, I'll have a mutiny on my hands for real.
If the other soldiers learn of this, they could mutiny.
Right, it would be a disaster.
Just what I was thinking.
I saw Valon die. I felt it.
I'm not convinced he is.
I'm not calling you a liar, but that was Valon--I'm positive.
My men can't find out. I could take them to pick off Valon's scouting parties... build up their morale....
But everyone will die without that heat exchanger!
If Valon really is alive, I need those scouting parties gone. Leave the rest to me.
Then we split the work.
You're right--sorry, I've been doing stuff single-handed. The heat exchanger's in this location.
I stopped Valon once. Whatever he's planning with the heat exchanger, I can stop him again.
I'll protect it.
You're a life saver. Here's the exchanger's location.
There's quite enough hysteria in your unit already. Now, what are our priorities?
Keep it together and think!
Priority one is the heat exchanger. You'd better take that, in case Valon shows up.
There's a Republic outpost... here, we can use while we're tracking those scouts. Come report to us there when the exchanger's safe.
I don't believe in ghosts, but this is... good luck.
Hey, you're back--with one thermal bore device, safe and sound. Maybe I can salvage this op after all.
Seems "Captain" Valon met his match--guess we softened him up for you, huh?
Your men held out against a strong enemy without reinforcements. No easy task.
You did well.
Though you did need us to complete that task for you....
With Valon dead, I imagine you're all eager to get off this world.
Glad to be going home?
Every time I turn around, my men are standing closer to the landing pad.
Put mines around it. They'll soon back off.
Thank you for this. You're, uh, really not how I imagined a Jedi Master to--argh. Sorry, priority call.
Thanks for your help. When my guys get back, we--huh, that might be them now.
Lieutenant, you wasted men and resources on a very simple assignment.
Don't joke. You failed here.
I--I'm sorry, sir. I accept full responsibility for--excuse me. That's a priority call.
No sign of the bore device? Transponder says it's still out there.
I'm telling you, LT. Getting out today is our best chance. Maybe our only chance!
Private Kree, I've noted your complaint. Twice. Now, kindly put a sock in it before--hey!
See, guys? Just when it seems bleak, in walks a Jedi. Welcome!
I heard some pirates were making life difficult for you. Perhaps I can assist.
I'm here to help.
Sounds good to me. I'm Lieutenant Felix Iresso, the ranking officer.
I was told to speak to the officer in charge.
Lieutenant Iresso?
You found him. Lieutenant Felix Iresso. Nice to see a friendly face.
Since you can't handle these pirates, I'm here to finish the job.
I'm taking command.
I... guess you do outrank me. Lieutenant Felix Iresso reporting, sir.
A Jedi. So what? Captain Valon will finish her off, like he did Dask and Antilles.
So he's a Jedi. Captain Valon will just tear him apart, like Dask and Antilles.
The private is referring to a White Maw foot soldier who became a major player overnight. When Valon and his followers started harassing the Outer Rim, they sent us in.
The LT forgot the best part, Jedi. Valon can't die!
Everything that lives, dies in its time.
Death is part of the Force.
Yes, Lieutenant, you should really have opened with a joke.
Very funny.
I hope you have a better explanation than that for your failure.
What a feeble excuse.
It's true! We've tried everything!
We even collapsed an ice tunnel on Valon! Next day, he's fighting us again!
Now he's stolen our thermal bore device. This is over! We're leaving today--
Enough back chat! All of you, dismissed!
Sorry. They're getting twitchy. Valon's putting up a fight, and he'll have plans for that thermal bore device.
A "thermal bore device" doesn't sound like a weapon.
Just what is this device?
The ice here is as thick as a Gamorrean's skull. A thermal bore melts it fast, for mining or building bases.
I understand your men's concerns. Let's get them out of here as soon as possible.
I'll help your soldiers.
Good thinking. But with that thermal bore device, Valon's got us pinned.
Your soldiers seem to believe that Valon is immortal.
What's this about "can't die"?
Sure, Valon's tough, but no one's unstoppable. I'm more worried about the device he stole.
Set that device in the wrong place, the ice shelf will crack and this base is history.
Recovering the thermal bore might help morale, but... my guys won't fight Valon again.
These are trained professionals, can't we appeal to their sense of honor?
Is there no way to rally them?
They need a victory, any victory. Please, can you help me out and find that device?
I can bring that device back for you.
Allow me to recover it.
Perhaps someone should teach your men to face their fears.
Cowards. I'll get the device.
I appreciate the help. If we don't get the device back, my guys'll pack up and leave. Today.
According to its transponder, the device is in an old Imperial science lab. It's not far. I'll be here, trying to stop a mutiny.
Watch your back around Valon, Jedi. I've seen him fight, and it's not pretty.
Stuck out here too, huh?
